meanings.definition: To exceed in weight or importance
meanings.sent1: The elephant's size can outweigh the strength of a lion.
meanings.sent2: In this decision, the benefits outweigh the risks.
meanings.sent3: When it comes to dessert, my love for ice cream can outweigh my desire for a healthy diet.
meanings.sent4: The impact of her words can outweigh the weight of any material possession.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of caring for a pet can outweigh the joy of having one.

meanings.definition: To be more significant or valuable than
meanings.sent1: Kindness can outweigh wealth in the eyes of many.
meanings.sent2: His experience in the field outweighs any academic qualifications.
meanings.sent3: The laughter of children can outweigh the stress of a long day.
meanings.sent4: The value of friendship can outweigh any material gift.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of nature can outweigh the chaos of city life.
